each) or four medium-sized 
cans of tuna a week (about 
140g when drained). These 
types	of	fish	contain	high	
levels of mercury, which 
can damage your baby’s 
developing nervous system. 
Don’t eat more than two 
portions	of	oily	fish	per	week.	
Oily	fish	includes	salmon,	
mackerel, sardines and trout. 
Fresh	tuna	was	classified	
as	an	oily	fish	until	recently.	
Recent studies have shown 
the	fish	oil	content	of	fresh	
tuna is similar to that of white 
fish.	Smoked	fish	has	been
